summary:
•	Broad experience (>35 years) in refugee protection and humanitarian operations: emergency preparedness planning and response; design of programmes to protect refugees, IDPs and other affected populations in conflict and post-conflict situations; forging linkages between humanitarian and development programmes; wider strategic asylum/migration issues.
•	Strong background in strategy development and programme evaluation.
•	In-depth knowledge of the wide variety of humanitarian and development actors and of the cluster approach. Experienced in working with governments, UN/international agencies, and civil society/NGOs. 
•	Field experience in Latin America, Africa, Asia, and Europe.
•	Fully proficient in English, Spanish and French.

profile_positions.description: Since 2019 (ongoing, Covid permitting): Researching "The Cape of Good Hope during the Napoleonic era and its aftermath". Recent assignments: Team Leader, Independent Evaluation of UNHCR's Country Operations in Angola, Botswana and Namibia; Assessment of Phasing Down UNHCR Presence during the period 2012-2016, UNHCR Evaluation Service, Geneva (2018). Coordinator, (IDP) Protection Assessment and Strategy Development, Office of the UN Resident and Humanitarian Coordinator, Bogotá, Colombia (Mar-Sep 2017). Member of the Protection Capacity (ProCap) Roster, Norwegian Refugee Council since 2015. Co-author of publications on humanitarian, refugee protection and human rights issues, such as "HIV in Emergency Contexts, a new strategic narrative"; Background Note for the UNAIDS Programme Coordinating Board Thirty-Sixth Meeting (UNAIDS/PCB (36)/15.13), 2015; "Effective Civil-Military Interaction in Peace Operations, Theory and Practice"; Springer Verlag, ISBN 978-3-319-26804-0 (chapter "Human Rights and Refugee Protection: The Interface with Humanitarian Actors"), 2013-14.
profile_positions.title: Independent Consultant

profile_positions.description: Led multidisciplinary teams in management reviews and inspections: critical evaluations of the relevance and impact of UNHCR programmes and their management (countries in Africa, Asia, Latin America, and M-East).
profile_positions.title: Special Advisor to the Inspector General

profile_positions.description: Developed operational and protection guidelines (e.g. for operations in highly insecure environments; for field-level engagement with Peacekeeping Forces in complex emergencies); conducted inquiries into serious operational and refugee protection problems (e.g. mass abduction of refugee children, Chad). Facilitated UN Country Teams/NGOs planning (e.g. Regional CAP for Iraq and surrounding region; Regional CAP for Southern Africa).
profile_positions.title: Deputy Director (a.i.), Department Operational Support

profile_positions.description: Led HQs-based team responsible for support to global coordination of UNHCR programming, to global priority setting and resource allocation processes, to organization-wide staff development in the field of programme/operations planning and management. Specific focus on the introduction of systematic collection and use of data in programme design, monitoring and evaluation (UNHCR's Results Based Management and "Standards & Indicators" projects).
profile_positions.title: Chief, Programme Coordination Section

profile_positions.description: Responsible for UNHCR programmes in the Southern Africa region (mainly SADC countries); led the Programme Department in the Regional Office. Facilitated regional UN inter-agency contingency planning for emergencies. Pioneered the first systematic collection of multi-sectoral data through independent (baseline) surveys and their use in the planning, monitoring and evaluation of UNHCR programmes.
profile_positions.title: Deputy Regional Representative

profile_positions.description: Led UNHCR in Western Sahara in preparation for the then expected mass repatriation of Sahrawi refugees from Algeria (and the development of a UN inter-agency refugee return and reintegration plan), Regional Coordinator during the Kosovo emergency (refugee registration) and during the Indonesia/East-Timor emergency (programme) followed by a 6-month secondment as Senior Humanitarian Advisor to the World Bank, Jakarta, Indonesia.
profile_positions.title: Deployments as coordinator/advisor to emergency operations

profile_positions.description: Performed programme evaluations, e.g. of UNHCR's global staff development programme and global training programme for NGO partners.
profile_positions.title: Senior Evaluation Officer (temporary assignment)

profile_positions.description: Led multidisciplinary emergency response teams in: Liberia, Rwanda, DRC/Kivu, Rwanda (post-genocide, to prepare for mass returns); Zambia. Participated in the development of UNHCR’s Needs Assessment and Contingency Planning Guidelines. Facilitated inter-agency contingency planning as well as operations planning for post-conflict mass return of refugees and other displaced communities (countries in Africa, Asia, Balkans).
profile_positions.title: Senior Emergency Preparedness and Response Officer (Emergency Teamleader)

profile_positions.description: Facilitated inter-agency planning for post-conflict refugee repatriation/reintegration operations: I was closely involved in the planning of the return and reintegration of thousands of ANC and PAC former exiles to South Africa following the unbanning of the two organizations; I facilitated inter-agency planning across six southern African countries for the return and reintegration programme of a million and a half refugees to Mozambique. I was a certified facilitator on the programme of the UN International Decade for Natural Disaster Reduction; I facilitated multiple government/UN inter-agency workshops in countries in Latin America and the Middle East (1991-94).
profile_positions.title: Senior Desk Officer

profile_positions.description: UNHCR in Western Honduras (1987-88) and Eastern Sudan (1988-91).
profile_positions.title: Programme Officer

profile_positions.description: Senior Policy Officer for Refugee Reception and Integration. Founding member of the International Standing Committee on Unaccompanied Refugee Children (1984), the first attempt at international operational coordination on the protection of this group of vulnerable refugees (in collaboration with ECRE, the European Consultation on Refugees and Exiles).
profile_positions.title: Senior Policy Officer

company.name: National Committee for Refugees and Exiles from Latin America.

profile_positions.company: National Committee for Refugees and Exiles from Latin America.
profile_positions.description: Member of the team formed in response to mass arrival of exiles from the civil-military dictatorships in Chile, Argentina, Uruguay, resettled through UNHCR. Specific responsibility for developing refugee integration programmes. Successfully advocated for the inclusion of refugees into government housing schemes, dramatically cutting their waiting time for permanent accommodation.
profile_positions.title: Policy Officer
